page.title: 14TRANSPORT DOWNDERRY/SEATON
page.content: The villages are served by the B3247 which forms the main street and part of the coastal link between Plymouth and Looe.Satellite hamlets and farms interconnect by a network of single track lanes.Most personal transport is by car,the bus service being limited to a once daily link with Plymouth. Inevitably extensive commuter traffic is generated.Holiday visitors overload the roads and the limited car parks in summer hence seasonal waiting restrictions near the beaches.Some recent improvement has been made with the construction of the new bridge at Seaton.Some use is made of the rail link at St.Germans.The elderly and those without cars rely on friends or the monthly shopping coach to reach the metropolitan services of Plymouth. It is fortunate that the shops and surgery provide for most urgent needs
